infodynamics.measures.continuous
Interface ChannelCalculatorMultiVariate

All Superinterfaces:
ChannelCalculatorCommon
All Known Subinterfaces:
MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate, MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithMarginals, TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariate
All Known Implementing Classes:
MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateGaussian, MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKernel, MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov, MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov1, MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov2, MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskovByMulti, MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskovByMulti1, MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateKraskovByMulti2, MutualInfoMultiVariateCommon, TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateKernel, TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov, TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateKraskovByMulti, TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateSingleObservationsKernel
public interface ChannelCalculatorMultiVariate
extends ChannelCalculatorCommon

An interface for calculators computing measures from a source to a destination for multiple joint variables in each (specific examples intended here are the mutual information and transfer entropy).

Author:
Joseph Lizier, email, http://lizier.me/joseph/

Parameters:
source - multivariate observations for the source variable (first index is time, second is variable number)
destination - multivariate observations for the destination variable (first index is time, second is variable number)
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

addObservations

void addObservations(double[][] source,
                     double[][] destination)
                     throws java.lang.Exception

Adds a new set of observations to update the PDFs with - is intended to be called multiple times. Must be called after ChannelCalculatorCommon.startAddObservations(); call ChannelCalculatorCommon.finaliseAddObservations() once all observations have been supplied.

Important: this does not append these observations to the previously supplied observations, but treats them independently - i.e. measurements such as the transfer entropy will not join them up to examine k consecutive values in time.

Note that the arrays source and destination must not be over-written by the user until after finaliseAddObservations() has been called (they are not copied by this method necessarily, but the method may simply hold a pointer to them).

Parameters:
source - multivariate observations for the source variable (first index is time, second is variable number)
destination - multivariate observations for the destination variable (first index is time, second is variable number)
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

addObservations

void addObservations(double[][] source,
                     double[][] destination,
                     int startTime,
                     int numTimeSteps)
                     throws java.lang.Exception

Adds a new set of observations to update the PDFs with - is intended to be called multiple times. Must be called after ChannelCalculatorCommon.startAddObservations(); call ChannelCalculatorCommon.finaliseAddObservations() once all observations have been supplied.

Important: this does not append these observations to the previously supplied observations, but treats them independently - i.e. measurements such as the transfer entropy will not join them up to examine k consecutive values in time.

Note that the arrays source and destination must not be over-written by the user until after finaliseAddObservations() has been called (they are not copied by this method necessarily, but the method may simply hold a pointer to them).

Parameters:
source - multivariate observations for the source variable (first index is time, second is variable number)
destination - multivariate observations for the destination variable (first index is time, second is variable number)
startTime - first time index to take observations on
numTimeSteps - number of time steps to use
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

setObservations

void setObservations(double[][] source,
                     double[][] destination,
                     boolean[] sourceValid,
                     boolean[] destValid)
                     throws java.lang.Exception

Sets the single set of observations to compute the PDFs from. Cannot be called in conjunction with ChannelCalculatorCommon.startAddObservations()/#addObservations(double[], double[]) / ChannelCalculatorCommon.finaliseAddObservations().

Parameters:
source - multivariate observations for the source variable (first index is time, second is variable number)
destination - multivariate observations for the destination variable (first index is time, second is variable number)
sourceValid - time series (with time indices the same as source) indicating whether the source at that point is valid.
destValid - time series (with time indices the same as destination) indicating whether the destination at that point is valid.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

setObservations

void setObservations(double[][] source,
                     double[][] destination,
                     boolean[][] sourceValid,
                     boolean[][] destValid)
                     throws java.lang.Exception

Sets the single set of observations to compute the PDFs from. Cannot be called in conjunction with ChannelCalculatorCommon.startAddObservations()/#addObservations(double[], double[]) / ChannelCalculatorCommon.finaliseAddObservations().

Parameters:
source - multivariate observations for the source variable (first index is time, second is variable number)
destination - multivariate observations for the destination variable (first index is time, second is variable number)
sourceValid - time series (with time indices the same as source) indicating whether each variable of the source at that point is valid.
destValid - time series (with time indices the same as destination) indicating whether each variable of the destination at that point is valid.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
